abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental and social assessment
            for the Ecuador Power and Communications Sectors
            Modernization and Rural Services Project anticipates likely
            negative environmental impacts and proposes measures to
            mitigate them. This report also analyzes the effectiveness
            of the environmental legislation for the energy and
            telecommunications sectors related to the project
            components, and discusses ways to strengthen policies and
            the institutional capacity for environmental management.
            Major impacts due to the internal combustion associated with
            thermoelectric generation are emissions of nitrous oxide and
            monoxide. Other potential impacts are significant water
            pollution, leakage of hydrocarbons, inadequate solid waste
            disposal, and noise affecting workers as well as neighboring
            populations. Potential impacts associated with hydroelectric
            generation include the deterioration in quantity of water
            resources, that is interrupted water flow, reduced water
            availability and regularity for use by the general
            population; a deterioration in water quality because of the
            excessive production of nutrients leading to anaerobic
            conditions., loss of the vegetal cover and acceleration of
            erosion caused by reservoirs and civil works, and increased
            noise and vibrations caused by machinery and equipment which
            would not only affect neighboring populations but the also
            the health of workers. Recommended mitigation measures to
            offset these impacts include devising policies to reduce
            emissions--in particular adhering to provisions of the Kyoto
            Accord, and relying on domestic agencies concerned with
            insuring environmentally sustainable development, as well as
            promoting use of renewable energy resources. Negative
            impacts likely to arise from energy transmission comprise
            destruction of forest and biodiversity, and interference
            with protected area management and fragile ecosystems
            because of transmission lines and installations, as well as
            reduced access to areas where theses structures are located,
            increased solid waste generation, electromagnetic radiation
            from transmission lines affecting humans and animal species,
            and a reduced right-of-way.
